msbt.message: You know what helps keep the old blood pressure low and the spirits high? <10_4 />Gardening! That's right, kiddo. I wouldn't be so pleasant and easygoin' if it weren't for these green thumbs.

Now, lemme tell you everything I know about bonsai trees. Gahaha!When you're plantin' a new one, you gotta make sure to get the feet set right in the hole of the planter. Did I say feet? I guess I meant roots.<10_4 /> I s'pose I kinda think of those durn bonsais like my own kids. Now, I gotta run. My precious bonsai babies are due for a nap!

Now, lemme tell you everything I know about bonsai trees. Gahaha!Like, did you know that you gotta water 'em in the mornin'?No one knows why, but they just do better if you give 'em a drink first thing every day. Me? I prefer a nice on the hour, every hour!

Now, lemme tell you everything I know about bonsai trees. Gahaha!See, you gotta make sure you're plantin' your bonsai in a big enough container. It needs room to grow! Right now I'm tryin' to grow the world's largest bonsai, myself.It's like a "world's hottest ice cube" kinda thing, but it keeps me busy, .
Lemme ask you somethin'. Are you very particular about anything in particular? Now, I know how that sounds. So just lemme talk at you before givin' you a chance to answer.

Takin' care of the things you own is more important than gettin' new things! Call me old-fashioned, but I'd rather keep fixin' the same thing and use it for 20 or 30 years. You know, like a real nice pair of pants. No reason you can't wear those for half a lifetime! Gahaha!

I can tell what kinda person you are by how you treat your stuff, y'see?If you treat things kindly, then you probably treat other folks kindly too. If you treat things poorly, well Let's just say I won't be lendin' you my anytime soon!

It's likedoesn't everything have a soul, kinda?That's why throwin' things away just doesn't feel right to me.It's also a good excuse as to why I have stacks of paper plates that are over nine feet tall in my garage.
One man's trash is another's treasure. You've heard that one, right? Well, listen up!

I'm gonna tell you all about MY personal treasure. It's my collection of letters! Folks don't write 'em anymore, which makes the ones I have even more special. Some of 'em are all faded and worn outbut then again, so are some of my favorite folks. Gahaha!

I'm gonna tell you all about MY personal treasure. It's this real smooth rock! No, not smooth rock like the music. It's like a real smooth river rock that I found as a youngster. I used to think it was valuable. Then I grew up and I realized that I was right! Gahaha!

I'm gonna tell you all about MY personal treasure. It's this broken radio I got from my pops. I couldn't ever get any station to come in perfectly, but pops and I used to tinker with it all the time. Those were the days, kiddo. Always take the time to appreciate what you have.
You know what?<10_4 /> I don't understand fashion! !

It's likeyou got your basic pants and shirt, right? Why do you need anything else? You ever see someone wearin', like, two shirts? Gahaha! It's as weird as wearin' two pairs of pants to me! And don't even get me started on the laundry implications of ownin' more than two shirts.

Take boots, for example. Why would you wear any other kind of shoe?You can garden in boots, you can march in 'em, you can wear 'em in the rain and the snow They last for 100 years and they smell like musty old feet if you treat 'em right. What's not to love?

Like, what about those hats that are half the size of your own body? Yeah, yeah, they're probably good for blockin' out the sun, but how can you see where you're goin'? , I guess some folks would say I can't see where I'm goin' anyway
You only live once, right? Is that what the kids say? Well, guess what. I agree!

Now, I'm not sayin' you should use that slogan as an excuse to get crazy every single day. I'm just sayin'live your life, kiddo! Do what you want to do and don't bother other folks doin' the same. It's a lot harder than it looks, I suppose. But I'm tryin'!

To put it simply, I wanna live the best life I can. No regrets!If I see a mountain, you bet I'm gonna try to climb it. Why not?AhI guess the problem is that every time I look at a mountain, I get tired.

Basically, I want to finish all of the projects I've ever started in my life. I guess it's kinda like a bucket- list thing. And first on the list? Complete my bucket collection! I've got this rock bucket from aught- six made out of pure nickel. It weighs 85 pounds and only holds two rocks. It's glorious and I need five more!
I remember when I was just startin' out with DIY stuff,

I started out just thinkin' I'd spend a few minutes, maybe just make somethin' small Next thing you know, it was dark out! And it wasn't just night—a whole week had passed!In the end, though, it was worth it. That flimsy axe lasted me almost 20 minutes. Gahaha!

I'm pretty sure I followed the recipe just right, but what I ended up with wasn't what I was expectin'!It was supposed to be , but it came out as !Bah! I just pretended it was and it worked out just fine. Gahaha!
I was hammerin' away with one hand when I hit my finger! Then I dropped the hammer on my toe And then my buddy laughed at me. If you're keepin' score, that's addin' insult to injury to injury!
Say, what're your thoughts on all this "online shopping" stuff everyone's up to these days?

I just don't know about buying stuff before I see it with my own two eyes.This one time I bought myself a tiny figurine to decorate a shelf, and a week later, this gigantic box arrived.It wasn't a figurine at all! It was nearly eight feet tall! Where was I supposed to put that, ?!The size did explain why it cost so blasted much though

Me? I don't know. Sometimes it seems like a bit of a scam.I remember once I was about to buy something, and the little doohickey said if I got 10, I'd get free shipping.Well now! I ain't the kind of to pass up a deal, so I doubled up, !Except I forgot I was orderin' a book. Next thing I knew, I had 10 copies of .

I'm just not sure. I don't trust it, and it seems far too easy to overspend.I went to order myself a new butter knife, but they kept putting all kinds of great offers in front of me.In no time at all, my cart had , , and in it!Sure, I wanted that stuff, but not all at once. And then I got to thinkin' How'd THEY know what I wanted?!Online shoppin' ain't for the faint of heartor wallet, !
